subject: RE: [junit] How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one o	r more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
msgSnippet: I guess this isn t immediate, but try: http://www.gnufoo.org/junit/index.html#failures It offers a patch for JUnit that allows Non-fatal Asserts...meaning you
messageBody:
I guess this isn't immediate, but try:

http://www.gnufoo.org/junit/index.html#failures

It offers a patch for JUnit that allows Non-fatal Asserts...meaning you can
continue to perform Asserts even after one fails. We are using it and it
works very well.

Josh

-----Original Message-----
From: Dinesh B Metkari [mailto:dinesh.metkari@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 30, 2002 7:58 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or
more assert methods fails in a TestCase?


Hi,
I am having one testcase say:

testInsert(){

assertTrue();
- - - - -
assertEqual();
- - -
assertXYZ()
}

In above case if first assert method i.e. (assertTrue()) fails, JUNIT
displays failure which is occurred at
first assert only & It dosent test or checks others assert() Methods.
My question is:
How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods
fails in a TestCase?

Expecting your immediate reply with solution.

Thanks & Regards,
Dinesh Metkari
